de.polygonal.ds.Graph<T>

type
class
implements
Collection<T>

A weighted graph.

A graph is composed of GraphNode and GraphArc objects.

See http://lab.polygonal.de/?p=185/

Worst-case running time in Big O notation

Constructor

new(?maxSize : Int)

parameters
maxSize the maximum allowed size of this graph.
The default value of -1 indicates that there is no upper limit.

Instance Variables

autoClearMarks : Bool

If true, automatically clears the mark-flag on all graph nodes prior to starting a new traversal.
Default is false;

borrowArc : GraphNode<T> -> Float -> GraphArc<T>

If specified, borrowArc() is called in order to create GraphArc objects.
Useful for pooling GraphArc objects. Default is null.

key : Int

A unique identifier for this object.
A hash table transforms this key into an index of an array element by using a hash function.
This value should never be changed by the user.

maxSize : Int

The maximum allowed size of this graph.
Once the maximum size is reached, adding an element will fail with an error (debug only).
A value of -1 indicates that the size is unbound.
Always equals -1 in release mode.

returnArc : GraphArc<T> -> Void

A function pointer responsible for returning GraphArc objects.
Required if borrowArc is specified. Default is null.

reuseIterator : Bool

If true, reuses the iterator object instead of allocating a new one when calling iterator().
The default is false.
If true, nested iterations are likely to fail as only one iteration is allowed at a time.

Instance Methods

BFS(?preflight : Bool, ?seed : GraphNode<T>, ?process : GraphNode<T> -> Bool -> Dynamic -> Bool, ?userData : Dynamic) : Void

parameters
preflight if true, an extra traversal is performed before the actual traversal runs. The first pass visits all elements and calls element.visit() with the preflight parameter set to true. In this pass the return value determines whether the element will be processed (true) or excluded (false) from the final traversal, which is the second pass (preflight parameter set to false). The same applies when using a process function.
seed the starting point of the traversal. If omitted, the first node in the list of graph nodes is used.
process a function that is invoked for every traversed node. The parameters are:
  1. a reference to the visited node.
  2. the preflight flag.
  3. custom data specified by the userData parameter (default is null).
Once process returns false, the traversal stops immediately and no further nodes are examined (termination condition).
If omitted, element.visit() is used. In this case the elements of all nodes have to implement Visitable.
userData custom data that is passed to every visited node via process or element.visit(). If omitted, null is used.
Performs an iterative breadth-first search (BFS).

DFS(?preflight : Bool, ?seed : GraphNode<T>, ?process : GraphNode<T> -> Bool -> Dynamic -> Bool, ?userData : Dynamic, ?recursive : Bool) : Void

parameters
preflight if true, an extra traversal is performed before the actual traversal runs. The first pass visits all elements and calls element.visit() with the preflight parameter set to true. In this pass the return value determines whether the element will be processed (true) or excluded (false) from the final traversal, which is the second pass (preflight parameter set to false). The same applies when using a process function.
seed the starting point of the traversal. If omitted, the first node in the list of graph nodes is used.
process a function that is invoked for every traversed node. The parameters are:
  1. a reference to the visited node.
  2. the preflight flag.
  3. custom data specified by the userData parameter (default is null).
Once process returns false, the traversal stops immediately and no further nodes are examined (termination condition).
If omitted, element.visit() is used. In this case the elements of all nodes have to implement Visitable.
userData custom data that is passed to every visited node via process or element.visit(). If omitted, null is used.
recursive if true, performs a recursive traversal (default traversal style is iterative).
Performs an iterative depth-first search (DFS).

DLBFS(maxDepth : Int, ?preflight : Bool, ?seed : GraphNode<T>, ?process : GraphNode<T> -> Bool -> Dynamic -> Bool, ?userData : Dynamic) : Void

parameters
maxDepth A maxDepth value of 1 means that only all direct neighbors of seed are visited.
preflight if true, an extra traversal is performed before the actual traversal runs. The first pass visits all elements and calls element.visit() with the preflight parameter set to true. In this pass the return value determines whether the element will be processed (true) or excluded (false) from the final traversal, which is the second pass (preflight parameter set to false). The same applies when using a process function.
seed the starting point of the traversal. If omitted, the first node in the list of graph nodes is used.
process a function that is invoked for every traversed node. The parameters are:
  1. a reference to the visited node.
  2. the preflight flag.
  3. custom data specified by the userData parameter (default is null).
Once process returns false, the traversal stops immediately and no further nodes are examined (termination condition).
If omitted, element.visit() is used. In this case the elements of all nodes have to implement Visitable.
userData custom data that is passed to every visited node via process or element.visit(). If omitted, null is used.
Performs an iterative depth-limited breadth-first search (DLBFS).

addMutualArc(source : GraphNode<T>, target : GraphNode<T>, ?cost : Float) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError source or target is null (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError source equals target (debug only).
Creates a bi-directional link between two nodes with a weight of cost (default is 1.0).
This creates two arcs - an arc that points from the source node to the target node and vice versa. n

addNode(x : GraphNode<T>) : GraphNode<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError size() equals maxSize (debug only).
Adds the node x to this graph. 1

addSingleArc(source : GraphNode<T>, target : GraphNode<T>, ?cost : Float) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError source or target is null (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError source equals target (debug only).
Creates an uni-directional link between two nodes with a weight of cost (default is 1.0).
This creates an arc pointing from the source node to the target node. n

arcIterator() : Itr<GraphArc<T>>

see
http://haxe.org/ref/iterators
Returns a new GraphArcIterator object to iterate over all GraphArc objects in this graph. The arcs are visited in a random order.

clear(?purge : Bool) : Void

parameters
purge if true, explicitly nullifies nodes and elements upon removal.
Improves GC efficiency/performance (optional).
Removes all elements. 1 or n if purge is true

inline clearMarks() : Void

Clears the mark-flag on all graph nodes that were set in a BFS/DFS traversal.
Call this method to start a fresh traversal. n

inline clearParent() : Void

Clears the parent pointers on all graph nodes. n

clone(?assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

parameters
assign if true, the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference.
If false, the clone() method is called on each element. In this case all elements have to implement Cloneable.
copier a custom function for copying elements. Replaces element.clone() if assign is false.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError element is not of type Cloneable (debug only).
Duplicates this graph. Supports shallow (structure only) and deep copies (structure & elements).

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this graph contains a node storing the element x. n

createNode(x : T) : GraphNode<T>

Creates and returns a node object storing the element x. 1

inline findNode(x : T) : GraphNode<T>

Finds and returns the node storing the element x or null if such a node does not exist. n

free() : Void

Destroys this object by explicitly nullifying all nodes, elements and pointers for GC'ing used resources.
Improves GC efficiency/performance (optional). n

inline getNodeList() : GraphNode<T>

returns
the first node in a list of GraphNode objects or null if the graph is empty.
The graph nodes stored as a doubly linked list of GraphNode objects. 1

inline isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if this graph is empty. 1

iterator() : Itr<T>

see
http://haxe.org/ref/iterators
Returns a new GraphIterator object to iterate over all elements stored in the graph nodes of this graph. The nodes are visited in a random order.

nodeIterator() : Itr<GraphNode<T>>

see
http://haxe.org/ref/iterators
Returns a new GraphNodeIterator object to iterate over all GraphNode objects in this graph. The nodes are visited in a random order.

remove(x : T) : Bool

returns
true if at least one node storing x was removed.
Removes all nodes storing the element x.
Nodes and elements are nullified. n

removeNode(x : GraphNode<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError graph is empty (debug only).
Removes the node x from this graph.
This clears all outgoing and incoming arcs and removes x from the node list. 1

inline size() : Int

The total number of elements in this graph.
Equals the number of graph nodes. 1

toArray() : Array<T>

Returns an unordered array containing all elements stored in the graph nodes of this graph.

toDA() : DA<T>

Returns an unordered dense array containing all elements stored in the graph nodes of this graph.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object.
Example:
	  var graph = new de.polygonal.ds.Graph<String>();
	  var a = graph.addNode("a");
	  var b = graph.addNode("b");
	  var c = graph.addNode("c");
	  graph.addSingleArc(a, b, 1.0);
	  graph.addSingleArc(b, a, 1.0);
	  graph.addMutualArc(a, c, 1.0);
	  trace(graph);
	  {Graph, size: 3}
	  |<
	    {GraphNode, val: c, connected to: a}
	    {GraphNode, val: b, connected to: a}
	    {GraphNode, val: a, connected to: c,b}
	  >|

toVector() : flash.Vector<Dynamic>

Returns an unordered Vector.<T> object containing all elements stored in the graph nodes of this graph.

unlink(node : GraphNode<T>) : GraphNode<T>

returns
the disconnected graph node.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError node is null (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError graph is empty (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError node does not belong to this graph (debug only).
Isolates node from this graph by unlinking it from all outgoing and incoming arcs.
The size remains unchanged as the node is not removed from the graph. (n² - n) / 2
